question.body: Which of the following is not a carbohydrate that could lead to obesity?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This monosaccharide is absorbed directly into the bloodstream during digestion.
Incorrect. This simple sugar is found naturally and artificially in high-fructose corn syrup.
Incorrect. This polysaccharide of glucose subunits is found in bread, pasta, rice and potatoes.
Correct. Cellulose is a carbohydrate similar in structure to starch, but it is not digestible; we consume cellulose in plant material as “roughage”.

part.hint: All of the choices are carbohydrates, but one cannot be processed for energy.
